sense.name: Put into words or an expression; express or state (clearly)
sense.examples: He articulated his concerns to the board of trustees. She articulated the needs of her constituency before the Senate. The goal of this workpackage is to articulate through worked examples some of the tools and techniques that can be adopted. The pianist articulated through music what no one at the funeral could express in words.

sense.name: Speak, pronounce, or utter in a certain way
sense.commentary: NOTE: Does not include reference to the content of the speech, simply the manner and fact (performance) of speaking. Compare to Sense 1.
sense.examples: She articulates French words in a funny way. I cannot articulate 'zip wire' with my braces on. Can the child articulate this complicated word?

sense.name: Provide with a joint; join together
sense.commentary: NP1[agent] ARTICULATE NP2[patient] NP1[instrument] ARTICULATE NP2[patient] NOTE: NP1 may be the AGENT or an INSTRUMENT with an implied AGENT. NOTE: Requires an AGENT or an implied AGENT. Compare to Sense 4, which cannot include an AGENT.
sense.examples: The carpenter articulated the two pieces of wood, forming a dovetail at the corner. We can articulate the parts of a machine so that they "obey" and manifest the rules of the Game of Life.

sense.name: Be united by forming a joint or joints
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 3; Sense 4 does not include an AGENT
sense.examples: The ankle bones articulate with the leg bones.

sense.name: Move through or along a path of motion
sense.examples: The shoulder articulates through a huge range of motion. These "vertebrae" articulate through ball-in-socket joints, and are controlled by muscles. Every muscle in her back articulated along the spine.
